commands.leaderboard¶

Classes¶

Leaderboard

This class generates a leaderboard, displaying the top point scorers based on completed tasks.

Module Contents¶

class commands.leaderboard.Leaderboard[source]¶

This class generates a leaderboard, displaying the top point scorers based on completed tasks.

Why: Useful for tracking task completion in a gamified environment, allowing users to see where they stand compared to others and encouraging active participation in completing tasks.

How: Common usage examples: 1. Leaderboard.view_leaderboard(top_k=5): Retrieve the top 5 users based on points.

base_leaderboard_block_format[source]¶
payload[source]¶
view_leaderboard(top_k: int = 5) → dict[source]¶

Retrieves and formats the leaderboard with the top K users by points from completed tasks.

Parameters:

top_k (int) – Number of top users to display on the leaderboard, default is 5.

Returns:

Payload containing leaderboard information for the top K users.

Return type:

dict[str, Any]

Why: Displays high-performing users in a structured format, motivating users to stay engaged by highlighting achievements and fostering a sense of competition. How: Example usage - ` top_users = leaderboard.view_leaderboard(top_k=10) `
